00035 class Flag {
00036   
00037  public:
00038 
00041   Flag() : on(false), off(false), na(true) {}
00042     
00045   void setNA() { on = false; off = false; na = true; } 
00046   
00049   void setOn() { on = true; off = false; na = false; } 
00050 
00053   void setOff() { on = false; off = true; na = false; } 
00054 
00057   bool isNA()  const { return na; } 
00058 
00061   bool isOn()  const { return on; } 
00062 
00065   bool isOff() const { return off; } 
00066 
00074   bool parseRuleLine(string &val, regex &reg);
00075 
00076  private: 
00077 
00078   bool on;
00079   bool off; 
00080   bool na;
00081 
00082 };

00089 struct Range {
00090 
00093   Range() : min(0), max(0), inverted(false), pattern("") {}
00094 
00097   Range(int mn, int mx, int in, string p) : min(mn), max(mx), inverted(in), pattern(p) {}
00098 
00099   int min;
00100   int max;
00101   bool inverted;
00102   string pattern;
00103   bool every = true;
00104   bool none = false;
00105   
00106   bool isValid(int val) {
00107     if (every)
00108       return true;
00109     if (none)
00110       return true;
00111     if (!inverted)
00112       return (val >= min && val <= max);
00113     else
00114       return (val < min || val > max);
00115   }
00116 
00117   void parseRuleLine(string line);
00118 
00119   friend ostream& operator<<(ostream &out, const Range &r);
00120 
00121   // set that this ranges accepts everything
00122   void setEvery() {
00123     every = true;
00124     none = false;
00125   }
00126 
00127   // set that this range accepts nothing
00128     void setNone() {
00129     every = false;
00130     none = true;
00131    }
00132   
00133   // return if this range accepts all values
00134   bool isEvery() const { return every; }
00135   
00136   // return if this range accepts no values
00137   bool isNone() const { return none; }
00138 
00139 
00140 };

00142 // a container to hold boolean rules based mostly on alignment flag
00143 struct FlagRule {
00144   
00145   FlagRule() {
00146     dup  = Flag();
00147     supp       = Flag();
00148     qcfail     = Flag();
00149     hardclip   = Flag();
00150     fwd_strand = Flag();
00151     rev_strand = Flag();
00152     mate_fwd_strand = Flag();
00153     mate_rev_strand = Flag();
00154     mapped          = Flag();
00155     mate_mapped     = Flag();
00156     ff = Flag();
00157     fr = Flag();
00158     rf = Flag();
00159     rr = Flag();
00160     ic = Flag();
00161   }
00162   
00163 
00167   /*bool inline flagCheck(Flag &f, bam1_t *b, int bamflag, bool inv) {
00168     
00169     if (!f.isNA()) {
00170       bool val = (b->core.flag & bamflag);
00171       if ( (f.isOff() && val) || (f.isOn() && !val))
00172         return inv ? false : true;
00173     }
00174     return true; 
00175     }*/
00176 
00177   Flag dup, supp, qcfail, hardclip, fwd_strand, rev_strand,
00178     mate_fwd_strand, mate_rev_strand, mapped, mate_mapped, ff, fr, rf, rr, ic;
00179 
00180   bool na = true;
00181   void parseRuleLine(string line);
00182   
00183   // ask whether a read passes the rule
00184   bool isValid(Read &r);
00185 
00186   friend ostream& operator<<(ostream &out, const FlagRule &fr);
00187 
00188   // set every flag to NA (most permissive)
00189   void setEvery() {
00190     dup.setOn();
00191     supp.setOn();
00192     qcfail.setOn();
00193     hardclip.setOn();
00194     fwd_strand.setOn();
00195     rev_strand.setOn();
00196     mate_fwd_strand.setOn();
00197     mate_rev_strand.setOn();
00198     mapped.setOn();
00199     mate_mapped.setOn();
00200     ff.setOn();
00201     fr.setOn();
00202     rf.setOn();
00203     rr.setOn();
00204     ic.setOn();
00205     na = true;
00206   }
00207 
00208   // set every flag to OFF everythign off)
00209   void setNone() {
00210     dup.setOff();
00211     supp.setOff();
00212     qcfail.setOff();
00213     hardclip.setOff();
00214     fwd_strand.setOff();
00215     rev_strand.setOff();
00216     mate_fwd_strand.setOff();
00217     mate_rev_strand.setOff();
00218     mapped.setOff();
00219     mate_mapped.setOff();
00220     ff.setOff();
00221     fr.setOff();
00222     rf.setOff();
00223     rr.setOff();
00224     ic.setOff();
00225   }
00226 
00227 
00228   // ask if every flag is set to NA (most permissive)
00229   bool isEvery() const { return na; }
00230 
00231 };

00234 class AbstractRule {
00235 
00236  public:
00237 
00238   AbstractRule() {}
00239   ~AbstractRule() {}
00240 
00241   string name = "";
00242   Range isize = {-1, -1, true, "isize"}; // include all
00243   Range mapq =  {-1, -1, true, "mapq"}; 
00244   Range len =   {-1, -1, true, "length"};
00245   Range clip =  {-1, -1, true, "clip"};
00246   Range phred = {-1, -1, true, "phred"};
00247   Range nm = {-1, -1, true, "nm"};
00248   Range nbases = {-1,-1,true, "nbases"};
00249   Range ins = {-1,-1,true, "ins"};
00250   Range del = {-1,-1,true, "del"};
00251   unordered_map<string,bool> orientation;
00252 
00253   std::string atm_file = "";
00254   bool atm_inv = false;
00255   size_t atm_count = 0;
00256 
00257 #ifdef HAVE_AHOCORASICK_AHOCORASICK_H
00258   //atm_ptr atm;
00259   AC_AUTOMATA_t * atm = 0;
00260 #endif
00261 
00262   uint32_t subsam_seed = 999;
00263   double subsam_frac = 1;
00264 
00265   bool none = false;
00266   // set to true if you want a read to belong to the region if its mate does
00267   //bool mate = false; 
00268 
00269   FlagRule fr;
00270 
00271   bool isValid(Read &r);
00272 
00273   void parseRuleLine(string line);
00274 
00275   void parseSubLine(string line);
00276 
00277   bool ahomatch(Read &r);
00278 
00279   bool ahomatch(const char * seq, unsigned len);
00280 
00281   void parseSeqLine(string line);
00282 
00283   friend ostream& operator<<(ostream &out, const AbstractRule &fr);
00284 
00285   void setEvery() {
00286     isize.setEvery();
00287     mapq.setEvery();
00288     len.setEvery();
00289     clip.setEvery();
00290     phred.setEvery();
00291     nm.setEvery();
00292     nbases.setEvery();
00293     fr.setEvery();
00294     atm_file = "";
00295     subsam_frac = 1;
00296   }
00297   
00298   void setNone() { 
00299     isize.setNone();
00300     mapq.setNone();
00301     len.setNone();
00302     clip.setNone();
00303     phred.setNone();
00304     nm.setNone();
00305     nbases.setNone();
00306     fr.setNone();
00307     none = true;
00308   }
00309 
00310   // return if this rule accepts all reads
00311   bool isEvery() const {
00312     return isize.isEvery() && mapq.isEvery() && len.isEvery() && clip.isEvery() && phred.isEvery() && nm.isEvery() && nbases.isEvery() && fr.isEvery() && (atm_file.length() == 0) && (subsam_frac >= 1);
00313   }
00314 
00315   // return if this rule accepts no reads
00316   bool isNone() const {
00317     return none;
00318     //return isize.isNone() && mapq.isNone() && len.isNone() && clip.isNone() && phred.isNone() && nm.isNone() && fr.isNone();
00319   }

00322 };

00381 // a hierarchy of mini rules to operate on
00382 class MiniRulesCollection {
00383 
00384  public: 
00385   
00389   MiniRulesCollection() {}
00390   ~MiniRulesCollection() {
00391     for (auto& i : m_regions)
00392       delete(i);
00393     
00394   }
00395   MiniRulesCollection(string file);
00396 
00397   string isValid(Read &r);
00398   
00399   friend ostream& operator<<(ostream& out, const MiniRulesCollection &mr);
00400   
00401   void sendToBed(string file);
00402 
00403   // check if we should do the whole genome
00404   bool hasWholeGenome() const {
00405     for (auto it : m_regions)
00406       if (it->m_whole_genome)
00407         return true;
00408     return false;
00409   }
00410 
00411   GenomicRegionVector sendToGrv() const;
00412 
00413   size_t size() const { return m_regions.size(); } 
00414 
00415   size_t numRules() const {
00416     size_t num = 0;
00417     for (auto it : m_regions)
00418       num += it->size();
00419     return num;
00420   }
00421  private:
00422 
00423   vector<MiniRules*> m_regions;
00424   
00425 };
